metadata.synopsis: The player discovers Thrumbo, a runaway zombie who escaped from his master, Mystic Carrion. Thrumbo tried to escape with threee 'brothers' (also zombie beggars), but the others got lost, so he's stuck waiting for them. He's hidden in the wardrobe, where the player can find him. If they mention Carrion, thrumbo will start a dialogue where the palyer learns about the existence of the canopic jar they need to destroy. If they don't mention Carrion, Thrumbo acts like a normal beggar, minding his own business.

14.speaker: Thrumbo
14.text: I - I told you already. This spot's taken.
14.context: NodeContext: Trying to mask his desperation, fearful

18.speaker: Thrumbo
18.text: Please - we don't have time to waste. Carrion's heart must  be destroyed.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I already gave Mystic Carrion his heart back. I'm hardly going to destroy it now.

27.speaker: Thrumbo
27.text: Please, you must finish the job - Carrion can't be allowed to keep hurting people. You must stop him.
27.context: NodeContext: grim satisfaction, 'ashes' playing on the player destroying the heart with fire. Urging the player to finish the quest.

29.speaker: Thrumbo
29.text: That slimy bastard. He hid it in me the whole time...
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrumbo stands next to his canopic jar, glaring at it. He appeals to the playerNodeContext: Appealing for help

96.speaker: Thrumbo
96.text: Please - take that foul thing and grind it to dust.

32.speaker: Thrumbo
32.text: What - what are you doing in here?
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: (In gameplay - Thrumbo came tumbling out of the wardrobe). Thrumbo looks around, panicked. He spots the player - NodeContext: To self, not aware of the player

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *You catch the scent of death on the man's clothes, his skin damp with decay. He appears... unwell.*

5.speaker: Thrumbo
5.text: This is my spot. Go on - find your own.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I came to find you. Mystic Carrion was very keen that I bring you home.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Hello, Thrumbo. Mystic Carrion's told me all about you.

2.speaker: Thrumbo
2.text: Mystic C-Carrion? You're working for him?

89.speaker: Thrumbo
89.text: Oh no, no, no. I knew he wouldn't let us leave in peace.

11.speaker: Thrumbo
11.text: You don't have to help him. He's the one you should be after, not me.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Don't worry - I killed Mystic Carrion already.

97.speaker: Thrumbo
97.text: You've met him - how can you need more justification than that?
97.context: NodeContext: Can't beleive he needs to explain further

59.speaker: Thrumbo
59.text: He - he murdered me. Murdered my friends. Snatched us up right from the dockside and - and made us these things.

48.speaker: Thrumbo
48.text: Monsters. Fit for gutting and grinding and desecrating the dead. He constantly abuses us, makes us do the worst things you can imagine.

105.speaker: Thrumbo
105.text: There used to be five of us. My friend Talus... he couldn't take it anymore. One day I saw him drive a coffin nail right through Carrion's skull. Then another. And another...

34.speaker: Thrumbo
34.text: We thought he'd done it, freed us all. Then when dawn came, Talus seized up suddenly - like something had a grip on him.

13.speaker: Thrumbo
13.text: We ran to help, but he just... exploded. I got so much blood and pulp in my eyes... When I looked back, Carrion was just stood there - completely unharmed.
13.context: NodeContext: with a shudder, still can't believe or explain it

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I killed Carrion myself. There's no way he'll come back.

22.speaker: Thrumbo
22.text: You killed him? Then it's too late... unless you can find a way to stop him resurrecting.
22.context: NodeContext: Dawning horror - he knows how this ends

28.speaker: Thrumbo
28.text: Since Talus died, I've been watching Carrion, trying to figure out his secret. And I think... I think he's a mummy lord.
28.context: NodeContext: Hesitant to share his theory, you might think it's stupid

33.speaker: Thrumbo
33.text: It's an ancient, evil being who refused to die. Who cannot die. I used to hear about them in stories, and I can't think of another explanation.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: He does seem rather keen on bandages...

94.speaker: Thrumbo
94.text: He likes to pretend he's not a walking corpse like the rest of us. Beneath those rags, he's as rotten as we are.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Don't be ridiculous. Mummy lords are legends and nothing more.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: As undead go, mummy lords are particularly hard to put to rest. I hope you're wrong.

15.speaker: Thrumbo
15.text: He as good as told me so himself!

9.speaker: Thrumbo
9.text: After Talus died, Carrion blindfolded me and took me to a strange place. A foul, ancient place, somewhere the living wouldn't dare to tread.

110.speaker: Thrumbo
110.text: Down there, he showed me a jar. Said it contained the secret to eternal life, and if I behaved, he would share it with me.

56.speaker: Thrumbo
56.text: I - I think it was his heart.

83.speaker: Thrumbo
83.text: I'm not stupid. I know what he did to my friend. Gods, how I'd love to smash that bastard jar. That's how you kill mummy lords, you know.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I already found his lair. The jar you saw - he hid it inside your body.

7.speaker: Thrumbo
7.text: What? His rotten heart was inside me this whole time?
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrumbo looks down at his chest, confused.

73.speaker: Thrumbo
73.text: Urgh, get it out. I have to get it out.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I'll find and destroy the jar. Where should I start?

103.speaker: Thrumbo
103.text: I'm not sure, but in the house, beneath Carrion's salon, there's a chamber. He never lets anyone down there, so it must be hiding something important. Perhaps it's there.

107.speaker: Thrumbo
107.text: I don't want to die like Talus did. I want to live. Well... you know what I mean.

12.speaker: Thrumbo
12.text: But be careful if you return to Carrion - he'll know you spoke to me. Make sure he doesn't see or smell you. He'll turn you into one of us and he'll know I sent you.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Let's not be too hasty. You say this jar grants immortality?

87.speaker: Thrumbo
87.text: Don't let yourself be tempted by it - whatever's in that jar must be destroyed.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I think I'd rather just kill you.

8.speaker: Thrumbo
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thrumbo tries to shield/protect himself (leading into combat)NodeContext: Scared

54.speaker: Player
54.text: A theory I have no intention of testing. I'm not getting involved.

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *If you didn't know better, you'd swear your refusal had broken the zombie boy's heart. Fortunately, it stopped beating some time ago.*

3.speaker: Player
3.text: That's horrible. All right, I'll help you. What can I do?

71.speaker: Thrumbo
71.text: We'd have to stop him resurrecting somehow. But I don't know how.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Do you know how Carrion brought himself back?

60.speaker: Thrumbo
60.text: If I knew that, I'd have tried to kill him myself.

65.speaker: Thrumbo
65.text: I know this is going to sound strange, but I've been watching him, trying to figure it out and... I think he's a mummy lord.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Quite the story. Now, will you die quietly, or are we doing this the hard way?

95.speaker: Player
95.text: You're the price he demanded for his aid.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I don't think so. He's offered a generous price for bringing you back to him.

57.speaker: Thrumbo
57.text: I don't understand. We're nothing to him, nothing to anyone. He never stopped telling us that.

85.speaker: Thrumbo
85.text: I wasn't doing any harm, just trying to beg a few coin to get by and he - he murdered me. Murdered my friends. Made us into these things.
85.context: NodeContext: Sorrowful - hates what he's become

98.speaker: Player
98.text: How did you end up working for Mystic Carrion?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Shouldn't have made a deal with him then, should you?

23.speaker: Thrumbo
23.text: Made a deal with him? You think I asked for this?

63.speaker: Thrumbo
63.text: Me and my friends, we were beggars. Used to sleep down near the docks when the Fists were on patrol. Carrion found us down there. He murdered us, made us like this.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Is everything all right? I think you might be sick.

77.speaker: Thrumbo
77.text: Er, yes, now that you mention it. *Cough.* Probably contagious. Best not come too close.
77.context: NodeContext: Coughing, leaning into your assumption so you'll back off.

47.speaker: Thrumbo
47.text: Yeah. Every beggar's got a spot to kip in. And this is mine. So clear off.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Trust me - I have no interest in staying here.

19.speaker: Thrumbo
19.text: Oh. Well. That's all right, then.
19.context: NodeContext: Unsure if you're telling the truth

104.speaker: Narrator
104.text: *The man's stench is unmistakable - death, decay, despair. This must be Thrumbo, the runaway Mystic Carrion was so eager for you to retrieve.*

75.speaker: Thrumbo
75.text: Stop making so much noise. You'll have the Fists sniffing around.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing, but with the air/posture of soemone trying to be as inconspicuous as possibleNodeContext: Trying to mask his desperation, fearful

81.speaker: Thrumbo
81.text: You came back! Please, tell me you found a way to destroy Mystic Carrion?
81.context: NodeContext: Trying to mask his desperation, fearful

109.speaker: Thrumbo
109.text: Please - if you won't help me, then just leave me be.
109.context: NodeContext: Trying to mask his desperation, fearful

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I know where Carrion keeps his canopic jar. It's inside your chest.

106.speaker: Thrumbo
106.text: No, no, no! We haven't found the heart yet!

55.speaker: Thrumbo
55.text: We're running out of time - you have to find it. Or come dawn, he'll be back, and he'll kill us both.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Carrion made other jars. Any idea what I should do with them?

91.speaker: Thrumbo
91.text: You should destroy them. Get rid of every rotten part of him.
91.context: NodeContext: Determined, could be an end node in some cases

39.speaker: Thrumbo
39.text: Be careful, though. He'll know you did it, and he'll be really angry.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Not so fast. I destroyed Mystic Carrion's heart.

62.speaker: Thrumbo
62.text: You - you did? Then what are you waiting for?
62.context: NodeContext: Disbelief, turning to excitement. Urging player to complete their quest

69.speaker: Thrumbo
69.text: You must destroy the rest of him! Put that monster in the grave where he belongs.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I destroyed another jar belonging to Carrion.

50.speaker: Thrumbo
50.text: Good riddance to it, but you still need to find the heart. Without that, he'll never be stopped.
